alert.note: Alert for Orofino, Grangeville Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 2:32AM MST until January 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow is expected for Grangeville and the Camas Prairie. Drifting snow may lead to road closures; of particular concern is US 95 from Whitebird Grade to Cottonwood and local west to east roads. By mid Monday morning, southerly wind gusts of 55-65 mph are expected. Localized power outages may also occur. No new snow accumulation is anticipated. This warning is for blowing and drifting snow in and around Grangeville and the Camas Prairie. * WHERE...Camas Prairie, Grangeville and vicinity. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with periods of near blizzard conditions possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
